title.narrative: : Research and Capacity Building for Health Financing Advocacy in Africa

description.narrative: Proposed Activities: 1.Through Christian Aid’s partner Tax Justice Network Africa, conduct a desk review and potentially KIIs with health advocacy organisations and networks to analyse and document the health financing status and implications of Tax policies and systems in the selected countries 2.Produce a high-quality country and regional/ multi country report and policy briefs with key advocacy messages on sustainable health financing and taxation in Africa – linking in gender inequality implications 3.Conduct virtual skills building sessions on health financing and advocacy for CA country and regional teams 4.Scope and facilitate linkages and participation in influencing spaces at national, sub regional and regional/AU level including through CSO reference group at the AU Summit, Africa Health Agenda Conference, WHO Africa Health Summit among others. 5.Work with colleagues in PPC to develop linkages with and feed into CA’s regional and global level advocacy and campaigns on Economic justice and Gender and inequality and created spaces for joint advocacy.

The project seeks to influence policies which will ultimately lead to a reduction in health inequalities and impoverishing out-of-pocket health expenditures for vulnerable and marginalised populations in Africa through advocacy and policy level engagements with the relevant stakeholders. This will be achieved through influencing increased public health spending on health through progressive and equitable taxation.
